verses.roman:
dattvā svam uttaraṁ vāsas
tasyai rājā vivāsase
gṛhītvā pāṇinā pāṇim
ujjahāra dayā-paraḥ

synonyms: dattvā—giving; svam—his own; uttaram—upper; vāsaḥ—cloth; tasyai—unto her (Devayānī); rājā—the King; vivāsase—because she was naked; gṛhītvā—catching; pāṇinā—with his hand; pāṇim—her hand; ujjahāra—delivered; dayā-paraḥ—being very kind.
translation: Seeing Devayānī naked in the well, King Yayāti immediately gave her his upper cloth. Being very kind to her, he caught her hand with his own and lifted her out.
